intro: Scleranthus oxystephanus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, often branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in coastal or inland dune environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and the flowers are usually pink or white, with five petals. Scleranthus oxystephanus is adapted to arid conditions and is found primarily in Europe and parts of western Asia.
